storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive email notifications for detected scheduling conflicts to ensure timely awareness

testCases.title: Validate email notification sent upon conflict detection
preconditions: User account exists with valid email address registered
User has email notifications enabled in preferences
Email server is configured and operational
System conflict detection service is running
Test email inbox is accessible for verification

steps.action: Log into the scheduling system with scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Create a new scheduling entry that conflicts with an existing schedule (e.g., same resource, overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is detected by the system and conflict alert is displayed in UI

steps.action: Note the exact timestamp when the conflict was triggered
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp recorded for delivery time verification

steps.action: Check the recipient's email inbox within 5 seconds of conflict detection
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received with subject line indicating scheduling conflict

steps.action: Open the email and verify it contains conflict details including conflicting schedules, resources, time slots, and affected parties
steps.expectedResult: Email displays complete conflict information with clear formatting

steps.action: Verify the email includes resolution guidance or instructions on how to resolve the conflict
steps.expectedResult: Email contains actionable resolution steps or links to conflict resolution interface

steps.action: Access the system's email delivery logs via admin panel or API endpoint GET /notifications/email/logs
steps.expectedResult: Email delivery log entry is created with status 'Sent' and timestamp

steps.action: Verify the delivery timestamp is within 5 seconds of conflict detection timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Email delivery time meets the 5-second performance requirement

steps.action: Check the email read receipt status in the system logs (if email client supports read receipts)
steps.expectedResult: Read status is logged correctly showing 'Read' or 'Pending' status

postconditions: Email notification successfully delivered to recipient
Email delivery and read status logged in system
Conflict remains active in system until resolved
Email remains in recipient inbox for future reference

testCases.title: Verify user notification preference settings
preconditions: User account exists with valid credentials
User has access to notification preference settings
Email notifications are currently enabled by default
System notification service is operational

steps.action: Log into the scheduling system with scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: User successfully authenticated and main dashboard displayed

steps.action: Navigate to user settings or preferences section
steps.expectedResult: Settings page loads displaying notification preferences options

steps.action: Locate the email notification toggle or checkbox for conflict notifications
steps.expectedResult: Email notification option is visible and currently enabled (checked)

steps.action: Disable email notifications by unchecking the option or toggling it off
steps.expectedResult: Toggle switches to disabled state and visual indicator shows notifications are off

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message displayed confirming 'Preferences saved successfully'

steps.action: Verify the preference change is persisted by refreshing the page or logging out and back in
steps.expectedResult: Email notification setting remains disabled after page refresh

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict by creating overlapping schedule entries
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected and displayed in UI, but no email notification is generated

steps.action: Check the user's email inbox for any conflict notification emails
steps.expectedResult: No email notification received in inbox

steps.action: Verify system logs to confirm no email was sent to the user
steps.expectedResult: Email logs show no delivery attempt for this user's conflict notification

steps.action: Return to notification preferences and re-enable email notifications
steps.expectedResult: Email notification toggle switches to enabled state

steps.action: Save the updated preferences
steps.expectedResult: Success message confirms preferences saved

steps.action: Trigger another scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detected by system

steps.action: Check email inbox within 5 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received confirming notifications have resumed

postconditions: Email notifications are re-enabled for the user
User preferences are correctly stored in database
System respects user notification preferences for future conflicts

testCases.title: Test email format and content correctness
preconditions: User account with valid email address exists
Email notifications are enabled
Multiple test devices available (desktop, mobile, tablet)
Email client applications are configured on test devices
System has sample conflict data ready for testing

steps.action: Log into the scheduling system and trigger a scheduling conflict with known details (specific resources, times, and parties)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected and email notification is triggered

steps.action: Open the conflict notification email in desktop email client
steps.expectedResult: Email opens successfully and displays properly formatted content

steps.action: Verify email subject line clearly indicates a scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: Subject line contains keywords like 'Scheduling Conflict Alert' or similar clear identifier

steps.action: Check email body for conflict details including date, time, resource name, and conflicting parties
steps.expectedResult: All conflict details match the actual conflict data and are accurately displayed

steps.action: Verify the email contains resolution instructions or guidance section
steps.expectedResult: Clear, actionable resolution steps are provided with appropriate formatting

steps.action: Check for contact information (support email, phone number, or help desk link)
steps.expectedResult: Contact information is present and clearly visible

steps.action: Verify email branding, logo, and professional formatting
steps.expectedResult: Email follows company branding guidelines with proper logo and color scheme

steps.action: Open the same email on a mobile device (smartphone)
steps.expectedResult: Email renders correctly with responsive design, text is readable without zooming

steps.action: Open the same email on a tablet device
steps.expectedResult: Email displays properly with appropriate layout for tablet screen size

steps.action: Test all hyperlinks in the email by clicking each link
steps.expectedResult: All links are functional and navigate to correct destinations (conflict resolution page, help documentation, etc.)

steps.action: Verify any 'View Conflict' or 'Resolve Now' buttons redirect to the correct system page with conflict details pre-loaded
steps.expectedResult: Buttons work correctly and deep-link to specific conflict in the system

steps.action: Check contact email addresses and phone numbers for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All contact information is correct and matches official company contact details

steps.action: Verify email footer contains unsubscribe or preference management link
steps.expectedResult: Footer includes proper unsubscribe/preference link as per email best practices

steps.action: Test email in different email clients (Gmail, Outlook, Apple Mail)
steps.expectedResult: Email displays consistently across different email platforms without formatting issues

postconditions: Email format validated across multiple devices and clients
All links and contact information confirmed functional
Email content accuracy verified against actual conflict data

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive SMS notifications for critical scheduling conflicts to ensure immediate awareness

testCases.title: Validate SMS notification sent for critical conflicts
preconditions: User account exists with valid mobile phone number registered
User has opted-in to SMS notifications
SMS gateway service is configured and operational
User has sufficient SMS quota or credits
Test mobile device is available and powered on
System can identify and classify critical conflicts

steps.action: Log into the scheduling system with scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: User successfully authenticated and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Create or trigger a critical scheduling conflict (e.g., conflict involving high-priority resources or urgent time slots)
steps.expectedResult: System detects and classifies the conflict as 'Critical' with appropriate severity level

steps.action: Note the exact timestamp when the critical conflict was triggered
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp recorded for SMS delivery time verification

steps.action: Verify the conflict is marked as critical in the system UI
steps.expectedResult: Conflict displays with 'Critical' label or high-priority indicator

steps.action: Check the registered mobile device for incoming SMS within 10 seconds of conflict detection
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification is received on the mobile device

steps.action: Open and read the SMS message
steps.expectedResult: SMS contains concise conflict summary including conflict type, affected resource, and time

steps.action: Verify SMS includes contact information or action instructions
steps.expectedResult: SMS displays support contact number or short URL for immediate action

steps.action: Access the system's SMS delivery logs via admin panel or API endpoint GET /notifications/sms/logs
steps.expectedResult: SMS delivery log entry exists with status 'Delivered' and timestamp

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between conflict detection and SMS delivery
steps.expectedResult: SMS delivery time is within 10 seconds of conflict detection timestamp

steps.action: Verify the SMS delivery status shows successful delivery confirmation from SMS gateway
steps.expectedResult: Delivery status is 'Delivered' with gateway confirmation code

postconditions: SMS notification successfully delivered to recipient
SMS delivery status logged in system with timestamp
Critical conflict remains active until resolved
SMS delivery metrics updated for reporting

testCases.title: Verify SMS opt-in and opt-out functionality
preconditions: User account exists with valid phone number
User currently has SMS notifications enabled (opted-in)
SMS notification settings are accessible in user preferences
System supports opt-in/opt-out functionality

steps.action: Log into the scheduling system with scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logged in and main interface displayed

steps.action: Navigate to user settings or notification preferences section
steps.expectedResult: Settings page loads showing SMS notification options

steps.action: Locate the SMS notification opt-in/opt-out toggle or checkbox
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification control is visible and currently shows opted-in status

steps.action: Disable SMS notifications by toggling off or unchecking the SMS notification option
steps.expectedResult: Toggle switches to disabled/opted-out state with visual confirmation

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message displayed: 'SMS notification preferences saved successfully'

steps.action: Verify the opt-out preference persists by refreshing the page
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification setting remains disabled after page refresh

steps.action: Check database or API to confirm opt-out status is stored correctly
steps.expectedResult: User's SMS opt-in status shows 'false' or 'opted-out' in system records

steps.action: Trigger a critical scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: Critical conflict is detected and displayed in system UI

steps.action: Wait 15 seconds and check mobile device for any SMS notifications
steps.expectedResult: No SMS notification is received on the mobile device

steps.action: Verify SMS delivery logs to confirm no SMS was sent
steps.expectedResult: SMS logs show no delivery attempt for this user due to opt-out status

steps.action: Return to notification preferences and re-enable SMS notifications by toggling on
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification toggle switches to enabled/opted-in state

steps.action: Save the updated preferences
steps.expectedResult: Success message confirms 'SMS notifications enabled successfully'

steps.action: Verify opt-in status is updated in system records
steps.expectedResult: User's SMS opt-in status shows 'true' or 'opted-in' in database

steps.action: Trigger another critical scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: Critical conflict detected by system

steps.action: Check mobile device within 10 seconds for SMS notification
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification is received confirming SMS notifications have resumed

postconditions: SMS notifications are re-enabled for the user
User opt-in status correctly stored and enforced
System respects user SMS preferences for all future critical conflicts

testCases.title: Test SMS message content and formatting
preconditions: User account with valid phone number and SMS opt-in status
Multiple mobile devices available for testing (different carriers and models)
SMS notifications are enabled
Critical conflict scenario is prepared with known details

steps.action: Log into the scheduling system and trigger a critical conflict with specific known details
steps.expectedResult: Critical conflict is detected and SMS notification process initiated

steps.action: Receive and open the SMS notification on primary test device
steps.expectedResult: SMS is received and displays in device's messaging app

steps.action: Verify SMS sender ID or phone number is recognizable and legitimate
steps.expectedResult: Sender shows company name or official SMS short code

steps.action: Check SMS message length to ensure it fits within standard SMS character limits (160 characters for single SMS)
steps.expectedResult: Message is concise and does not exceed character limit or is properly segmented if longer

steps.action: Verify SMS contains accurate conflict summary including conflict type or severity
steps.expectedResult: SMS clearly states 'CRITICAL CONFLICT' or similar urgent indicator

steps.action: Check that SMS includes essential conflict details: resource name, date, and time
steps.expectedResult: All critical conflict details are present and match actual conflict data

steps.action: Verify SMS includes contact information (phone number or support contact)
steps.expectedResult: Valid contact phone number or support identifier is included

steps.action: Check for any shortened URLs or links in the SMS
steps.expectedResult: If URL is present, it is properly formatted and uses secure short URL service

steps.action: Click or tap any links included in the SMS
steps.expectedResult: Links open correctly and direct to appropriate conflict resolution page or system login

steps.action: Test SMS display on different mobile devices (iOS, Android, different carriers)
steps.expectedResult: SMS displays correctly on all tested devices without character encoding issues

steps.action: Verify special characters, dates, and times are formatted correctly across devices
steps.expectedResult: No garbled text, proper date/time format, special characters display correctly

steps.action: Check for any broken links or incorrect phone numbers by attempting to use them
steps.expectedResult: All phone numbers are dialable and links are functional without errors

steps.action: Verify SMS does not contain any formatting issues like extra spaces, line breaks, or truncated text
steps.expectedResult: Message is cleanly formatted with proper spacing and complete text

steps.action: Test SMS readability and clarity by having multiple users review the message
steps.expectedResult: Message is clear, professional, and conveys urgency appropriately

postconditions: SMS content validated for accuracy and completeness
SMS formatting confirmed across multiple devices and carriers
All links and contact information verified as functional
